message.content:
{"id": "124570", 
"title": "Bug 124570 - Preview from toolbar always shows first report opened in session", 
"description": "Bug 124570 - Preview from toolbar always shows first report opened in session", 
"OB": "When clicking on the Preview button on the toolbar after opening the Sales Invoice report, the Product Catalog report is displayed instead.", 
"EB": "After opening the Sales Invoice report and clicking on the Preview button again, the Sales Invoice report should be displayed.", 
"SR": "To reproduce the problem:\n1. Start BIRT 2.0 RC2 and create a project.\n2. Import the attached two designs into the project.\n3. Open the Product Catalog and click on the Preview button on the toolbar to view the report.\n4. Close the viewer.\n5. Open the Sales Invoice report and click on the Preview button again."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '124570', 'title': 'Bug 124570Preview from toolbar always shows first report opened in session', 'description': 'Bug 124570Preview from toolbar always shows first report opened in session ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Open Sales Invoice and click on the Preview button again.Actual Result: You see the Product Catalog report again.Expected Result: You should see the Sales Invoice report. ', 'SR': 'To reproduce the problem:1. Start BIRT 2.0 RC2, create a project and import the attached two designs into the project.2. Open Product Catalog and then click on the Preview button on the toolbar to see the report. Once you have viewed the report, close the viewer.3. '}
